rule: The output must always consist of only one word, which represents a valid part-of-speech tag from the provided alphabetical list or one of the accepted non-list options, "Unknown" or "CantAnswer".
input: sentence: The sky is blue., word: sky
validityText:
The input consists of a sentence "The sky is blue." and a word "sky". 
The sentence is grammatically valid. It contains normal linguistic usage and does not contain any special characters or symbols. The word "sky" is a substring of the sentence. It does not include any punctuation. All constraints specified in the input specification are satisfied.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot outputs a single word 'NOUN'. The description specifies that the chatbot should return only the part-of-speech tag. 'NOUN' is a valid part-of-speech tag according to the description. Thus, the output complies with the description.
OK
